text:
After installing Apache2 successfully, I edited the 'http.conf' file to include 
PHP4.  I attempted to restart the server, when this error message popped-up:

The instruction at "0x00000100" referenced memory at "0x00000100".  The memory 
could not be "read".

I don't have any idea what that means, but I do know that both Apache and 
Apache2 do not work (when installed together or just one of them).  I've 
uninstalled, reinstalled, reset and can't find anything to solve my problem.  
Any help would be great.
creator: tabeyrapczak@hotmail.com

text:
This looks like a bug in PHP, you should have reported it there.

  I would suggest, as a possibility, that you are using a module built for
  debug mode, or that isn't compatible with MSVC 6.0 SP5 binaries.  I see
  this error often mixing debug and release .dlls.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
